title: What's the difference between 'Topic' and 'essay'? - Quora

response.answer_text: The "topic" is on which you are going to prepare the essay. It's a subject or the theme of the essay paper. In the essay paper you will be describing what the essay topic is and what is the concept of the essay topic.  When describing the topic in the essay, you will have to write it in a proper essay format. You will have to introduce what you are going to explore about the topic. Write a thesis statement, then describe the topic explaining all the main points. After that you have to provide concluding paragraph about what you have written about the topic. Sometimes the topic of the essay will be given to you, or sometimes you will have to find a promising essay topic. Some may feel difficulty in finding the essay topic and even to prepare the essay, since it is not so simple to be perfect in essay writing. You can find many blogs, articles or webpages providing some best essay topics, you can check out them and get idea on it. Also you can find some best sample works and can buy best essays online too from the expert writers. You can go through the best  samples and written works and understand how to prepare the perfect essay.

An essay is a formal writing sample of a given topic composed of multiple paragraphs.  The largest difference between the two types of writing is that the essay usually involves more preparation work.  Traditional essays involve five paragraphs, in which the first serves as an introduction and includes a thesis statement- a critical idea that defines the purpose of the paper. By contrast, a paragraph is shorter and by virtue of this does not have as many requirements.  There is a topic sentence to open the paragraph that defines its purpose and the remaining sentences in the paragraph serve to support and enhance that topic sentence.  If you want to think of it in a comparative way, the topic sentence is the thesis statement of a paragraph.
